security: This document details covert activities aimed at destabilizing the Cuban government, including plans for sabotage, assassination attempts, and establishing contacts for financial support and coordination against Fidel Castro. The document references plans to furnish $20,000 to a 40-man group of followers in Camaguey with the aim of raiding La Cabaña prison. Revealing these details could expose ongoing or planned covert operations, endangering individuals involved and compromising intelligence sources. As directly quoted from the document, it speaks to plans that "Don Fidel may not last until the New Year" and to 'reorganize our rank and file, since the thing is soon,' signaling imminent subversive actions.
summary: This document, dated October 26, 1959, details the activities of anti-Castro groups in Cuba and Miami, including plans for sabotage, assassination attempts, and efforts to reorganize and fund counter-revolutionary movements.
summary_one_paragraph: A CIA document dated October 26, 1959, reveals the activities of anti-Castro groups, including the Cruzada Revolucionaria Anti Comunista, led by Reinaldo BLANCO Navarro. The document outlines plans for sabotage and assassination attempts in Cuba, particularly targeting La Cabaña prison. It describes communication networks between leaders in prison and followers in Miami, efforts to secure funding, and strategies for reorganizing counter-revolutionary groups. Manuel BLANCO Navarro in Miami sends messages to Orlando VELAZCO in Cuba, instructing him to contact Reinaldo BLANCO Navarro in prison and establish a courier system, while also seeking financial support from various individuals and contacts.
title: Report on Anti-Castro Activities
